text: Violetta Quesada Díaz (born July 11, 1947) is a retired sprinter from Cuba who helped win a silver medal in 4 x 100 metres relay at the 1968 Summer Olympics, the first Olympic medal ever achieved by Cuban women. ==References== Sports Reference Category:1947 births Category:Living people Category:Cuban female sprinters Category:Olympic athletes of Cuba Category:Olympic silver medalists for Cuba Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1968 Summer Olympics Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1967 Pan American Games Category:Pan American Games medalists in athletics (track and field) Category:Pan American Games gold medalists for Cuba Category:Medalists at the 1968 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic silver medalists in athletics (track and field)
title: Violetta Quesada
